gui.components
Class GuiComponent

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              javax.swing.JLabel
                  gui.components.GuiComponent
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.event.ActionListener, java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, java.util.EventListener, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.SwingConstants, TReceiver
Direct Known Subclasses:
GuiAnimationComponent, GUIBin, GUIConveyor, GUIConveyorArrow, GUIGlass, GUIPartMover, GUIPopUp, GUISensor, GUIShuttle, GUITruck, NonAbstractGuiComponent
public abstract class GuiComponent
extends javax.swing.JLabel
implements java.awt.event.ActionListener, TReceiver

The GuiComponent class is the superclass for all components in the factory GUI. It provides methods to change the location of the component, and to update the component. Subcomponents must override the update method with their own function.

See Also:
Serialized Form

setCenterLocation

public final void setCenterLocation(int x,
                                    int y)
Moves this component to a new location. The middle of the new location is specified by the x and y parameters in the coordinate space of this component's parent.

Parameters:
x - the x-coordinate of the new location's middle point in the parent's coordinate space
y - the y-coordinate of the new location's middle point in the parent's coordinate space

setCenterLocation

public final void setCenterLocation(java.awt.Point p)
Moves this component to a new location. The middle point of the new location is specified by the x and y parameters in the coordinate space of this component's parent.

Parameters:
p - the point defining the middle point of the new location, given in the coordinate space of this component's parent

getCenterLocation

public final java.awt.Point getCenterLocation()
Gets the location of this component in the form of a point specifying the component's middle point. The location will be relative to the parent's coordinate space.

Returns:
an instance of Point representing the middle point of the component's bounds in the coordinate space of the component's parent

moveComponent

public final void moveComponent(int dx,
                                int dy)
Moves this component relative to its current location a specified distance. Keep in mind that this is relative movement!

Parameters:
dx - the horizontal distance to move the component. To move left, dx should be negative, to move right, positive
dy - the vertical distance to move the component. To move up, dy should be negative, to move down, positive

actionPerformed

public abstract void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent ae)
Called every time the gui Timer is fired. Updates the Component graphically according to its function. Subclasses must implement this method with their own animations.

Specified by:
actionPerformed in interface java.awt.event.ActionListener

eventFired

public abstract void eventFired(TChannel channel,
                                TEvent event,
                                java.lang.Object[] args)
Called every time the transducer is fired. Corresponds to an Agent command, to which the component should respond.

Specified by:
eventFired in interface TReceiver
Parameters:
channel - the channel the event was fired on
event - the event type
args - any arguments the message needs
